Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Rabbit neutrophil peptide 5 (NP-5, natural AMPs; alpha defensin; UCSS1a; mammals; animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: log deduction after 20 min incubation with 50 ug/ml peptide. Active against S. aureus strains 566, 502A, J.F. (reduction 0.1-0.4 logs), S. epidermidis UCLA-622 (reduction 0.4 logs), S. pneumoniae Type III (reduction 1.9 log), S. agalactiae Type I-A or III (reduction 0.4-0.5 logs), L. monocytogenes 450 (reduction 0.2 logs), P. aeruginosa PAO579 (reduction 0.7 logs), E. coli ATCC 29648 (reduction 0.2 logs), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (reduction 1.2 logs), S. marcescens (reduction 0.2 log), H. influenzae Type 3A (reduction 1.2 log), B.bronchiseptica UCLA-342 (reduction 0.0 log).Antimicrobial robustness: pH-sensitive:S. agalactiae; pH-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae.Structure: C: 19%; G: 16%; R: 13%.  It contains three disulfide bonds. This is the first defensin whose structure was investigated by 2D NMR spectroscopy. The distance geometry structure was reported in 1988 and a Monte Carlo structure was reported in 1989 (Levy et al., 1989). Updated 7/2021; Seq updated 9/2023
Literature Information.Author: Selsted ME, Brown DM, DeLange RJ, Harwig SS, Lehrer RI.1985
Literature Information.Title: Primary structures of six antimicrobial peptides of rabbit peritoneal neutrophils
